docs.lead_paragraph: A COMMON viral infection may be the first step in a complex process in which human arteries become clogged as people age, a growing number of heart specialists say. Although some experts say the findings are entirely circumstantial, a number of other scientists are impressed by evidence linking the disease of clogged arteries, atherosclerosis, with a member of the herpes virus family called cytomegalovirus.

headline.main: Common Virus Seen As Having Early Role In Arteries' Clogging
